article_text:
2:29

High-Tech Railgun Promises New Military Advantage

A powerful new Naval railgun can fire a round that could travel from Washington, DC to Philadelphia in under two minutes. Pentagon officials believe the high-tech cannon could pave the way for a military advantage defending assets on sea and on land. Photo: U.S. Department of Defense

article_metadata.description: Opinion Journal's Mary Kissel and Editorial Board Member Joe Rago analyze the third Republican debate. Plus, Paul Ryan's challenges as House Speaker, how to replace ObamaCare and the coming Puerto

og.description: Opinion Journal's Mary Kissel and Editorial Board Member Joe Rago analyze the third Republican debate. Plus, Paul Ryan's challenges as House Speaker, how to replace ObamaCare and the coming Puerto Rico bailout.
og.title: Opinion Journal: GOP Debate: Rubio's Moment?

article_summary:

Pentagon officials believe the high-tech cannon could pave the way for a military advantage defending assets on sea and on land.
Photo: U.S. Department of Defense
